title: drumspace
author: drumspace
content: I'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:20:13 PMI'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?There is a topic you may want to visit: Current list of exchanges without KYCBut those are centralized exchanges.My recommendation would be you consider using decentralized exchange, but that needs a bit more reading to understand what to do to not get scammed by other users.I won't recommend a certain DEX, but a great list I can simply quote is:Quote from: Charles-Tim on October 13, 2022, 04:01:22 PMMost decentralized: https://bisq.network/More liquidity: https://localcryptos.com/Also recommended: https://hodlhodl.com/

comments.author: drumspace
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on November 23, 2022, 01:28:43 PMQuote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:20:13 PMI'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?There is a topic you may want to visit: Current list of exchanges without KYCBut those are centralized exchanges.My recommendation would be you consider using decentralized exchange, but that needs a bit more reading to understand what to do to not get scammed by other users.I won't recommend a certain DEX, but a great list I can simply quote is:Quote from: Charles-Tim on October 13, 2022, 04:01:22 PMMost decentralized: https://bisq.network/More liquidity: https://localcryptos.com/Also recommended: https://hodlhodl.com/Sorry. I am looking to swap between crypto like BTC/LTC or ETH/BTC without KYC, and not to fiat.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: You can use the below link to read about no KYC exchanges, some like Kucoin are centralized, but you can read about the exchanges on the site, how decentralized they are or not, if totally decentralized like Bisq or centralized is reviewed on the site.https://kycnot.me/@NeuroticFishIt was painful that Localcrypto announced that they were closing down after five years: After 5 years, LocalCryptos is saying goodbyeBisq trading pairs: https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchanges/bisq

comments.author: Ludmilla_rose1995
comments.body: Quote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:20:13 PMI'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?I am one of the users of the exchange Code:https://remitano.com/ so far I use it (make withdrawals and deposits) without requiring KYC,, all you need is to enter your email address and phone number, but if you want to increase the withdrawal limit to more than $100 / day, you must do KYC level 1, so on.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:41:46 PMSorry. I am looking to swap between crypto like BTC/LTC or ETH/BTC without KYC, and not to fiat.For small amounts, I could recommend a few exchanges (FixedFloat, CoinPlaza, and more). For large amounts, I wouldn't dare trust any of them without splitting it up into many small transactions.

comments.author: Zwei
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on November 24, 2022, 02:26:45 PMQuote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:41:46 PMSorry. I am looking to swap between crypto like BTC/LTC or ETH/BTC without KYC, and not to fiat.For small amounts, I could recommend a few exchanges (FixedFloat, CoinPlaza, and more). For large amounts, I wouldn't dare trust any of them without splitting it up into many small transactions.I have used FixedFloat and CoinPlaza multiple times and both are great, they also have low fees compared to other more known exchanges AFAIK.

comments.author: s1lverbox
comments.body: Quote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:20:13 PMI'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?Non custodial without kyc and with native chains like btc and eth and many others. Just go visit thorswap.exchange Everything possible thanks to thorchain.

comments.author: limitless_777
comments.created_time: November 27, 2022, 02:37:26 AMLast edit: November 27, 2022, 03:09:49 AM by limitless_777
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on November 24, 2022, 02:26:45 PMQuote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:41:46 PMSorry. I am looking to swap between crypto like BTC/LTC or ETH/BTC without KYC, and not to fiat.For small amounts, I could recommend a few exchanges (FixedFloat, CoinPlaza, and more). For large amounts, I wouldn't dare trust any of them without splitting it up into many small transactions.FixedFloat has KYC. And even worse. They block client's money if a client refuses to pass KYC, they don't make a refund and keep coins to themselves. They just don't have KYC / AML policy on their website but they have KYC in fact. Check their reviews: https://www.bestchange.ru/fixedfloat-exchanger.html. The reviews are in Russian but you can use Google Translate. They block money and Bestchange's admin closes disputes and makes them gray instead of red without getting resolved. So FixedFloat keeps people's money and disputes are closed. Please check my topic about Bestchange: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5423039.0. It's also in Russian but I'll translate it and post on the English forum in a few days, just hadn't time to translate it yet. I think Bestchange's admin shares profit with such scam exchangers because he keeps them and closes almost all disputes while clients don't receive any refunds.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: limitless_777 on November 27, 2022, 02:37:26 AMFixedFloat has KYC. And even worse. They block client's money if a client refuses to pass KYC, they don't make a refund and keep coins to themselves. They just don't have KYC / AML policy on their website but they have KYC in fact.I haven't experienced that by myself, but this is one of the reasons I recommend to only send small amounts at once.QuoteCheck their reviews: https://www.bestchange.ru/fixedfloat-exchanger.html. The reviews are in Russian but you can use Google Translate. They block money and Bestchange's admin closes disputes and makes them gray instead of red without getting resolved.I know reviews on BestChange are unreliable, that's why I left Best_Change neutral feedback. I've now also added the same feedback to Best.Change (that's the user account that created BestChange's topic). If you create your topic in English, I'll read it.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: Alternatively if you aren't satisfied on those exchange then the best is to use P2P service from your local community ( Local thread or board) sometimes you could deal with them directly without incurring any kyc rather using an escrow from a reputable user here. From recent developments it's very important to apply caution while trading on any exchange and if there's no kyc then there would be some certain amount you could deposit inside which they might likely seek your identity otherwise would result in long stories. So using p2p to trade any currency you needed would be the best at this current situation. Note! not your key not your coin.

comments.author: BayAreaCoins
comments.body: We offer crypto2crypto trading only, no KYC, and no email account if you don't want (strongly recommended though).https://altquick.com/No JS trading: https://github.com/FreeBitcoins-com/docs/blob/master/xchange-api-offical-docs.mdTry it for free with real crypto: https://freebitcoins.com/faucet/

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: drumspace on November 23, 2022, 01:20:13 PMI'm looking to exchange between some few crypto currencies without KYC. Anyone have any recommendations?Do you have a problem submitting your official documents? If you prefer privacy and anonymity when using exchange platforms, the choice is yours. There are many exchange platforms that you can use without KYC, such as the ByBit platform. You can easily create an account on ByBit and trade currencies comfortably, and you can withdraw a maximum of 2 bitcoins per day, Also, on the PrimeXBT platform, you can trade on it for many trading pairs that are based on Bitcoin. The last exchange platform, CRYPTON EXCHANGE, is a good platform and will help you with instant deposits and withdrawals with no limits or restrictions, It still has a limited number of currencies, the most important of which are Bitcoin, USDT, XMR, and DAI.

comments.author: Honnet43
comments.body: It seems to me that it is not necessary to use the exchange for that. You can just use a multi-currency wallet with an instant exchange feature. New Hitbtc wallet does this really well.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: This is an old article from Kucoin and it's dated and published last year. And I haven't found another new article that's related to account limits. So, this is what it says.Quote from: https://www.kucoin.com/news/announcement-regarding-the-adjustment-of-daily-withdrawal-limitDear KuCoin users，Daily withdrawal limit has been adjusted to 1 BTC for accounts which do not complete identity verification(KYC).Please complete identity verification(KYC) to increase your daily withdrawal limits to up to 200 BTC.Note: Withdrawal limits refresh on a 24 hours rolling basis.We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. Thank you for your understanding and support! The KuCoin TeamIt's a centralized exchange but maybe that could add up to your choice since 1 btc withdrawal limit per day is still high unless you're that type of whale that do withdrawals 2-3 digits or more of bitcoin.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Quote from: Honnet43 on December 08, 2022, 02:43:35 PMIt seems to me that it is not necessary to use the exchange for that. You can just use a multi-currency wallet with an instant exchange feature. New Hitbtc wallet does this really well.What are you talking about? Hitbtc is actually an exchange and the wallet is need to have verification process as stated on their page. The thing is this exchange is known has a problem and there's many users create accusations thread against this exchange.There's other non custodial wallet that claim to not have any verification process, but actually it's wrong since when you installed the wallet you need to perform KYC or at least the wallet will monitor your activity since you're using their server.Quote from: https://hitbtc.com/walletHigh-level securitySecure your account with 2FA &identity verification, and manageaccess from other devices

comments.author: Wilfreda Asemar
comments.body: If you’re looking for exchanges to help you do that, there are a few that come highly recommended by the community at large. For bitcoin exchanges, I suggest checking out LocalBitcoins and Bitstamp. For Ethereum, check out Poloniex and Shapeshift.io. And for anything else, CoinMarketCap has a helpful list of all the major exchanges.

comments.author: Commguard
comments.body: I don't know of any, but I can KYC for you using my docs, at a fee

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Quote from: Commguard on December 21, 2022, 12:20:26 AMI don't know of any, but I can KYC for you using my docs, at a feeNot recommended. Exchanges will not only ask for user verification once (take Binance for example), they can be more strict than usual. Whoever takes this will forever depend on you and the fees to you will not be completed even once.
